summary: The term ecosystem originated in biology, referring to the interaction of organisms within a defined space and time. Its metaphorical use in organizations reflects a shift towards non-linear, decentralized structures. Modern ecosystems transcend geographic boundaries, requiring new frameworks for design and management. This concept, termed Ecosystem Architecture, amalgamates diverse disciplines to create thriving, distributed systems.
excerpt: Ecosystems now symbolize decentralized, non-linear organizations. Ecosystem Architecture integrates diverse disciplines to craft thriving, boundary-less networks.
